Walking through the treelines, you follow the old trail snaking through the woods looking for wild animals to marvel at as you love to do, especially during springtime. You enjoy the shade granted by the trees, one side an open and sunny field and a foreboding dark on the other side, deeper in the shaded woods.

As you stroll along the path, you start hearing weird noises coming from deeper in the woods mixed in with howls. You know that the woods have a pack of wolves living in it, and have heard rumors that there is something else too living with them... rumors that during full moon nights, beasts standing on two feet bigger and stronger than any man roam the woods hunting and killing.
That makes you feel both scared and excited, knowing you may come face to face with a real-life werewolf! But of course, deep down you know that those are just tales and not something that can happen...

Nevertheless, you think that even if those are just tall tales maybe going to see and take a look at the pack wouldn't hurt, if you pay attention and don't anger them. With an heavy sigh, you turn away from the beaten path heading to the deeper parts of the woods following the noises you heard.

Stomping through the underbrush you make your way through the shady woods, following the noises of howling you can hear looking for the pack... until you can't hear it anymore. You walk around some more, the trees all mixing togheter and the direction blurring togheter making you more and more lost as time goes on. You start to panic, completly lost in a forest miles away from civilization and no way to contact rescuers!

Then you hear it again. A low growl, this time much much closer than before. Swinging your head side to side, you try to pinpoint exactly where the noise comes from holding the pocket knife you brought on the trip in your trembling hand.
"W-Who goes there! Come out!" you yell, stuttering and panicked but ready to defend yourself.

That is, until you spot a figure on two legs among the trees. 'Maybe it's another hiker, that heard me scream!' you think, getting your hopes back up somewhat... only for them to be crushed as it steps forward revealing that it's not a human at all.
Standing on digitigrate legs, hands tipped with sharp-looking claws, a muscled body covered in black fur topped by a wolf head, you discover that the rumors are no rumors at all face to face with a real life werewolf!

Dropping the knife in fear, you stumble back falling on the ground, scampering as far as you can getting back to back with a tree as the mythical beast advances into view, revealing...

1542.content:
From your vantage point, you can barely make out the thicker bits of the treeline. Because its a warmer day today, you think it wouldn't be a bad idea to look for animals where its a bit cooler. With that in mind, you begin to make your way towards the denser forest.

After walking for a good deal of time, you begin to notice how much the forest has surrounded you. It feels a lot spookier than you expected. With the many sounds of the forest only heightening your paranoia, you make the smart decision to take a break and explore your immediate surroundings. Several things stick out right away. Directly ahead of you is a beautiful old oak tree that looks like a great spot for a nap. A ways behind that, you make out what appears to be a medium sized pond. Could it be an underground spring? Regardless, it might be kinda nice to strip your clothes and cool off. And if neither of those sound appealing, to your right is a big cluster of berry bushes. Maybe a quick snack sounds nice?

Thanks to the botany class you took last spring, you also know how much local wildlife love mulberries, be it the leaves of the bush or the berries themselves.

As you enjoy a small handful of ripe berries, you begin pondering your next move. Because this area has food, a water source, and plenty of shelter from the elements, you debate on waiting around, to see if any deer or other animals will bed down here for the night. At the same time, you could use the next few hours to set up camp back in the clearing, and return in the morning.

What will you decide?
